Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2009 02:11PM BellydancerinNJ wrote: I'm starting chemo this Friday, the 27th, so I figured I would join this thread.  Nervous, scared, but ready to get this over with.  I'll be doing every other week for 16 weeks (4xAC, then 4 of Taxol).  Anyone else on a similar treatment plan?
Posts.Title: **NEW** Starting Chemo March 2009 ginagina celia088

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2009 12:57PM BellydancerinNJ wrote: Thanks for the drink gina!  It's perfect!  I hope everyone's doing well.  My first tx on Fri. was ok.  I had the port placement in the morning, then chemo after so that took a toll on me but by Saturday my appetite was back.  Had my Neulasta shot that day too.  I even went to work today.  Feeling very fatigued and sore from surgery. Good luck to everyone this week! Caroline
Posts.Title: **NEW** Starting Chemo March 2009 ginagina celia088

Posts.Content: May 23, 2009 11:55AM BellydancerinNJ wrote: Hey Jeanette, I'm 28, diagnosed in February, and know how terrified you are.  At least the biopsy will let you know what you need to do, whether the lump is benign or not.  You should be enjoying your last few weeks of school and looking forward to college, and I'm so sorry you have to experience this.  Should it come back as cancer take comfort in knowing that you have this discussion board as a resource and it's full of wonderful women who have been through every aspect of this disease.  The beginning of this process is so difficult because you're full of questions and fears.  I hope you have a parent or someone with you when you go for your biopsy.  Surround yourself with those you love.  Keep us posted and good luck. Caroline
Posts.Title: Too Young I need advice. netty90 Kaidog

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2009 08:51PM BellydancerinNJ wrote: Glad your 1st A/C went well!  I've had two so far and have found hair loss and fatigue to be my most significant side effects.  Fatigue kicks in for me for about 3-5 days after tx, hair loss started a few days after my 2nd one.  I take emend, zofran, and compazine too and they seem to do the trick. Lots of luck for the rest of your treatments! Caroline
Posts.Title: No Port, First Chemo, On With The Show! lizardbreath LRM216

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2009 08:57AM BellydancerinNJ wrote: Thanks for sharing your story Kathy.  Lots of luck and I hope you continue to stay well!
Posts.Title: One Year Ago Today... BBLady BBLady

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2009 03:44PM BellydancerinNJ wrote: Mary, Make sure you bring a notebook with you full of questions you want to ask your onc, and write the answers down as s/he explains them to you.  Or have someone else take notes for you if you bring someone.  You'll get getting so much info so you want to remember it all.  Good luck! Caroline
Posts.Title: First ONC visit- what to expect? TexasRose TexasRose

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2014 12:46PM bellydancer wrote: There will/should be further investigation.  Discordant results often result from poor sampling.  Please PM if you would like to discuss this further Debra
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: May 8, 2009 10:13AM BellydancerinNJ wrote: I felt the lump in my left breast getting dressed, and w/in a few days it felt painful too so I saw my doc right away.  I have enlarged lymph nodes in the left arm pit area and had noticed that I had been sweating more than usual for months prior to diagnosis.  I didn't think much of it, i'm left handed, very active.  My docs think that has nothing to do with the cancer but since I'm halfway through chemo I've noticed the sweating is no longer what it was.  So who knows!
